use constant enum instead.
Also, the //not temporary comment refers to TransactionController.IS_DEFAULT, which becomes less apparent after your change. I suggest bringing the priority to the next line.

timeline.author: arnaud-splice

timeline.bodyText: Should we really use such a high number? If I understand correctly, hbase's own system tables use 200, so I don't think we should go above that.
timeline.author: arnaud-splice

replies.bodyText: SPLICE_INIT table should not be created, so no need to change its priority.
replies.author: jyuanca

timeline.author: arnaud-splice

timeline.bodyText: Define a separate withPriority instead of conflating name and priority setters in one method.

timeline.bodyText: Please use first lower case for method names
timeline.author: dgomezferro

timeline.bodyText: The change are not necessary, because priority will be bumped up in UpgradeScriptForTablePriorities
timeline.author: jyuanca

replies.bodyText: when we have to change the priority of a table, we have to 1. disable the table 2. change priority 3. re-enable the table. That process of enable + disable takes about 1s per table, however when we set the table priority already when creating, it is 0ms. So doing it like this is faster. The actual check if a priority is correct or needs upgrade is very fast.
replies.author: martinrupp

timeline.bodyText: Try not to use deprecated HTableDescripor
timeline.author: jyuanca

timeline.bodyText:
We only need to set priority for splice system tables, so no need to check for all tables in HBase, especially when there are 100K+ tables on the cluster. It will take a while to read all the table descriptors.
You can get all tables and indexes in schema SYS, SYSIBM, and SYSIBMADMIN are available at DataDicitonaryImpl.coreInfo and DataDicitonaryImpl.noncoreInfo. Other important tables are HBaseBackupUtils.spliceSystemTables. Only processing these tables can make upgrade time independent of cluster size. An example to add a property value to table descriptor is UpgradeScriptToAddCatalogVersion.
timeline.author: jyuanca

replies.bodyText: ok, fixed. sdd.upgradeTablePriorities will have a list of tables to check
replies.author: martinrupp

timeline.bodyText: Nitpick: use getNonCoreTI(), which invokes faultInTabInfo for you.
timeline.author: jyuanca

timeline.bodyText: Nitpick: I would not even include VERY_HIGH since it maps to something that may be dangerous to use. (HIGH_QOS being even greater than SYSTEMTABLE_QOS that is used for HBASE system tables)
timeline.author: arnaud-splice

replies.bodyText:
it's not higher, it's equal. Still, i can remove.
public static final int SYSTEMTABLE_QOS = HIGH_QOS;
replies.author: martinrupp
